incidents.name: Log Search Performance issues on Fly-Metrics.net

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented. You may see elevated search latency for your app logs.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.

We are continuing to investigate this issue. 

Viewing logs via the Fly.io Dashboard live log viewer,  `flyctl logs`, and the fly-log-shipper remain unimpacted by this.

We are currently investigating issues with the log search in the fly-metrics.net grafana dashboard. Users may see log queries take longer than usual, or fail with a timeout error. Retries generally succeed.

Viewing logs via the fly.io/dashboard log viewer, `flyctl logs`, and the fly-log-shipper are not impacted by this.
This incident has been resolved.
We're seeing networking latency and packet loss return to normal across all regions. We are continuing to monitor.
We're seeing improvements to latency and packet loss across all regions. We're continuing to work with our upstream providers.
Our upstream providers have identified the issue and are working on mitigations.
We are working with our upstream providers to resolve this issue.
We are investigating network issues between various regions. Machines may experience increased latency or packet loss. Machines API requests may occasionally fail.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented by Depot (https://status.depot.dev/incidents/01K8NTPVB41CD7NT3059QQ5MD8), and we are seeing recovery. We are continuing to monitor.

We are seeing intermittent deploy failures when using Depot builders. Customers can also follow the Depot status page at https://status.depot.dev for updates.

Customers can still deploy using Fly.io hosted builders with `fly deploy --depot=false`

We are seeing deploys using Depot builders succeed again, but we are continuing to monitor.

Customers can still deploy using Fly.io hosted builders with `fly deploy --depot=false`

We are investigating failures when trying to build using the default Depot builders. 

The recommended workaround is to use `--depot=false` with `fly deploy`.

The error is`Error: failed to fetch an image or build from source: error building: unavailable: unexpected EOF`
The networking issue has been resolved.

incident_updates.body:
We've identified the problem and confirmed that the IPv6 connectivity issues are intermittent. The problem stems from a faulty network switch in our SJC region, and we're working with our upstream provider to get it resolved.

If you're seeing issues here, please consider disabling IPv6 if you app doesn't need it, or moving Machines to a different region. This issue only affects outbound IPv6 traffic in SJC.

incidents.name: Errors due to upstream provider outages

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Docker systems are recovering and we are not seeing any further platform issues.

We are aware of outages in some services that rely on upstream providers.

Deployments may fail due to a Docker outage.

components.name: Deployments
components.description: flyctl and GitHub Action app deployments

incidents.name: "unauthorized" errors when starting some Fly builds

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

We're continuing to investigate the issue. Both legacy Fly builders and Buildkit builders are affected by this - if you're running into this error, please try deploying with `--depot=true`. (The default `fly deploy` and `fly launch` use Depot builders, which remain unaffected by this issue.)

We're investigating reports of "unauthorized" errors when doing `fly deploy` operations using the `--depot=false` parameter. This is not enabled by default, and Depot builders are unaffected. If you're seeing this error, try deploying with `--depot=true` to work around problems with legacy Fly builders.

components.name: Deployments
components.description: flyctl and GitHub Action app deployments

incident_updates.body:
Between approximately 10:58 UTC and 11:25 UTC, Fly.io experienced degraded proxy performance in multiple regions, including IAD, FRA, EWR and LHR.
During this period, users may have observed intermittent connection errors or elevated response times.

The elevated traffic has subsided, and proxy performance is back to normal.

affected_components.name: Regional Availability - LHR - London, United Kingdom

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to implement fixes to address dashboard errors.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
The issue has been identified and we are working on a fix.
Our dashboard is experiencing intermittent 500 errors. All other services continue to work as normal.

incidents.name: Registry pulls using a local docker client return an error

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Newly pushed images should not hit this. We are monitoring errors actively.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
Registry pulls locally using a docker client return a "manifest not found" error. This shouldn't affect `fly deploy`. We are investigating this issue.

This issue has been resolved. 

Any users still encountering errors deploying, please check and make sure your flyctl version is >=v0.3.180, and update with `fly version update` if not.

We have seen a strong decrease in errors for most users. We are seeing some 401 errors still for users using old versions of flyctl.

Users encountering a 401 error and using a version under v0.3.180, should run `flyctl version update` to update to the latest flyctl version.

A fix has been deployed and we are monitoring the results. We are seeing a decrease in 401 / 499 errors when deploying. 

This issue primarily impacted users deploying apps via the Fly Dashboard, deploys using flyctl versions lower than v0.3.180, and deploys involving building very large images.
Users may notice intermittent 4XX errors while pushing to Fly registry.

components.name: Deployments
components.description: flyctl and GitHub Action app deployments

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We've applied mitigations to the impacted regions and are seeing a significant improvement in packet loss. Most regions are back to normal networking performance. 
BOM (Mumbai) has improved, but continues to see slightly elevated loss. We are continuing to monitor for full recovery

We are working with our networking providers to restore normal operation. We are seeing an improvement in packet loss in most regions, though users may see intermittent loss at this time.

 BOM (Mumbai), CDG (Paris), NRT (Tokyo), SIN (Singapore) are still seeing higher rates of packet loss. Users may see degraded networking performance connecting to or from machines in those regions.
We are currently investigating elevated packet loss between a number of regions. Users may see degraded network performance when connecting to or from their machines.
This incident has been resolved.

New app logs are once again stably flowing into the fly-metrics.net dashboard. Users should see and be able to search all app logs from 22:30 UTC onwards. We are continuing to monitor the customer logs cluster to ensure continued stability.

Not all historical logs were able to be backfilled. Many users will see missing or incomplete logs for the period between 08:00 - 22:30 UTC Oct-06-2025.
We are continuing to backfill historic logs into fly-metrics.net.  New logs will be accessible once the backfill is complete.

We have applied a fix and historic logs are now backfilling into fly-metrics.net.  New logs will be accessible once the backfill is complete.

Customers can continue view live logs for their apps using the `flyctl logs` command and from the logs tab of their app page at Fly.io/dashboard.

We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue. Searchable logs in the fly-metrics.net Grafana board remain unavailable at this time. 

Customers can view live logs for their apps using the `flyctl logs` command and from the logs tab of their app page at Fly.io/dashboard .
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
Grafana is returning 5xx errors when loading logs.
This incident has been resolved.
We've identified the issue within Quickwit data source for logs. We're implementing a fix.
We found out that loading old logs via Grafana is return 5xx errors. Tailing live logs via UI and CLI is working.
This incident has been resolved.

incidents.name: Fly.io Dashboard error when adding credit cards

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Were investigating an issue where some customers see a "Something went wrong" error when adding a credit card in the Fly.io dashboard.

incidents.name: Docker rate limit errors when using `fly deploy`

incident_updates.body: This incident is now resolved, Depot builders should be working correctly now.

We're still rolling out configurations to mitigate this issue. Note that this issue only affects users with builders in some US regions. In the meanwhile, trying the recommended workarounds, or relocating your builder (Settings -> App builders) to either Dallas, Chicago or Toronto should allow your builds to complete successfully.
We've identified the root cause for this issue and are implementing mitigations.

We are investigating sporadic build failures mentioning Docker rate limits on "unauthenticated pulls" and error 429.

In the meantime, workarounds to try in order are:
1. Use `fly deploy --depot=false`
2. Use `fly deploy --buildkit`
3. Install Docker locally and use `--local-only` with Fly deploy

incidents.name: Network Issues in FRA, GRU, SCL, and SIN

incident_updates.body:
We've identified and mitigated a Fly Proxy issue affecting hosts on the FRA, GRU, SCL, and SIN regions. Network connectivity has been fully restored and all services have returned to normal. 

Affected Hosts on the regions experienced connectivity issues for 1 hour and 10 minutes ( 12:30 - 13:40 UTC ).

This incident has been resolved.
This incident has been resolved.
Traffic has been rerouted to all affected regions. We will continue to monitor network performance.
We are continuing to address networking issues affecting traffic between the USA and some European regions.
We are working with our upstream providers to establish alternate network paths.
We are working with our upstream providers to resolve this issue.
We are investigating reports of network issues across various regions, mainly EU/NA. Apps are still running, but may experience packet loss or higher latency.
This incident has been resolved.
One of our upstream providers is having network connectivity issues in EWR. You may experience increased latency, packet loss, or total connectivity failure while they investigate the issue.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We've identified an issue with our state replication system and are working on a fix.
We are investigating an issue with fly.dev domain DNS resolution. Default fly.dev domains for apps may fail to resolve. Custom domains continue to work.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We are seeing high packet loss in HKG. We are working with our upstream providers to establish alternate routes to HKG.

incidents.name: Some billing operations failing to synchronize

incident_updates.body: Everything is working normally and billing tasks have run to completion and stabilized.
We've fixed the issue and are monitoring normalization while DNS records propagate and pending processes run to completion.
Due to a DNS issue (it's always DNS, isn't it?), some billing-related operations are going unprocessed. This affects mainly registration of payment methods. Usage metering is not affected.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are investigating network issues in HKG region.

incidents.name: Name resolution for Fly Consul cluster degraded

incident_updates.body: This incident is resolved and services depending on Consul should be working correctly now.

DNS has been restablished and services depending on Consul should start recovering, though due to DNS caching behavior this may take a few minutes to propagate. We are monitoring the situation to ensure full recovery.

DNS for the Fly Consul cluster is currently degraded. This primarily affects unmanaged Postgres clusters. We are working on restoring DNS operation for this domain. This DNS degradation does not affect any other user-facing components and should not affect running machines, apps or any APIs.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results
We are seeing intermittent networking issues on some nodes in IAD
This incident has been resolved.
The upstream provider is working to recover the WireGuard server in IAD region. We will provide further updates as available.
Due to an issue with an upstream provider, 6PN WireGuard peers are currently not able to connect in IAD region. We are working with the upstream provider to resolve this issue.

Due to issues with an upstream internet backbone provider, we saw elevated rates of packet loss across our network between  14:15 - 14:35 UTC. 
This has been resolved and networking is working as expected.

A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are working with our upstream providers to establish an alternate network path.

We're continuing to monitor to ensure full recovery.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Users may see a 500 error loading logs for some apps. Viewing logs in your app's Fly Dashboard page or via the `flyctl logs` command is working as normal.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are experiencing network issues in ORD. Some destinations are unreachable. We are working with our upstream providers to fix it ASAP.

incident_updates.body:
This incident has been resolved and all MPG clusters in ORD are operating as expected. 

During this incident a small number of clusters in ORD would have seen degraded or failing connections when using the PGBouncer connection pooler URL to connect to their database.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

We are currently investigating a host issue resulting in a small number of MPG clusters in ORD to be in degraded status. If you're having trouble connecting to your database, please get in touch via the support portal.
